properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 5 at 4:28AM AKST until January 5 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 40 below occuring. The cold wind
chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to
exposed skin. Northeast winds gusting to 25 mph. Drifting snow
will cause large drifts to form.

* WHERE...Central Interior over Elliot Highway Summits.

* WHEN...Now to 6 PM this evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds gusting to 25 mph will
cause drifting snow and wind chills to 40 below over Elliot
Highway Summits. Travelers should be prepared to encounter snow
drifts and dangerously cold wind chills. Winds are expected to
decrease this evening and the low wind chill values will
moderate then.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING
